title: 109_hr3988
content:
The Act titled "Gulf Coast Small Business Recovery Act" prioritizes small businesses in procurement related to Hurricane Katrina and Hurricane Rita. The "Gulf Coast Small Business Recovery Act" prioritizes businesses with a significant presence in Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas for procurement related to Hurricane Katrina and Hurricane Rita. The "Gulf Coast Small Business Recovery Act" mandates that a certain percentage of procurement contracts related to Hurricane Katrina or Hurricane Rita reconstruction be awarded to small businesses in Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas, with a focus on providing maximum opportunities for small business participation. The "Gulf Coast Small Business Recovery Act" requires federal departments to ensure contracts comply with subcontracting goals for small businesses and submit a report on opportunities provided for small business concerns. The subsection providing opportunities for small businesses will terminate one day after all Federal Disaster Declaration notices for Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas are lifted. SEC. 3. Gulf hurricane disaster-affected small businesses treated as HUBZone for Small Business Act purposes during Federal Disaster Declaration period. SEC. 4. Prohibition on permanent relocation of federal facilities from Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas. Prohibition on permanent relocation of federal facilities from Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas. No federal facility can be permanently moved from a Gulf hurricane disaster-affected area to a location outside that area. This prohibition will end after two years from the enactment of this Act. Reports must be submitted if a federal facility is temporarily relocated for more than 6 months. The Committee on Homeland Security and Government Affairs requires reports on the temporary relocation of federal facilities from Gulf hurricane disaster-affected areas to locations outside that area. Reports must be submitted every 6 months for the duration of the temporary relocation period. SEC. 5. DEFINITIONS. (a) Gulf Hurricane Disaster-Affected Small Business Concern defined as small businesses in Gulf hurricane-affected areas as of August 28, 2005.
(b) Gulf Hurricane Disaster defined as events caused by Hurricane Katrina or Rita declared major disasters by the President.
(c) Gulf Hurricane Disaster-Affected Area defined for the purposes of the Act. For the purposes of this Act, a "Gulf hurricane disaster-affected area" refers to counties or parishes in Louisiana, Mississippi, Alabama, or Texas designated for disaster assistance due to Hurricane Katrina or Rita. A "small business concern" is defined as per section 3 of the Small Business Act. SEC. 6. EFFECTIVE DATE: This Act will take effect 10 days after its enactment.
